intro: Pereskia tampicana, commonly known as the cactus apple, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a shrub-like plant with thick, fleshy stems that are covered in short, stiff hairs. The plant produces large, showy flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in the summer months. Its fruit is a green, fleshy berry that turns red when ripe and is edible. The plant is adapted to arid environments and has a succulent structure to store water.
